title: "To be rich in admiration and free from envy, to rejoice greatly in the good of others, to love with...

attachments.displayName: "To be rich in admiration and free from envy, to rejoice greatly in the good of others, to love with such generosity of heart that your love is still a dear possession in absence or unkindness - these are the gifts which money cannot buy." - Robert Louis Stevenson (1850-1894), Essayist, Poet, Novelist

object.content: "To be rich in admiration and free from envy, to rejoice greatly in the good of others, to love with such generosity of heart that your love is still a dear possession in absence or unkindness - these are the gifts which money cannot buy." - Robert Louis Stevenson (1850-1894), Essayist, Poet, Novelist
